Privacy we respect your privacy section 1 subtitle
screen.uicontrol:
TomTom International B.V. and its affiliates around the world ('TomTom') believe that we can only use your data when we respect your privacy. We do everything it takes to keep your private data truly private. You don't want to find out that other companies secretly run away with your details when you're using TomTom products.

When you are using this app, we want you to understand what personal data we collect from you and how we are using it. We also tell you how you can control what we do with your data. With your data you're helping TomTom to make better products that help you to reach your destination, safely and comfortably.

This privacy statement was last edited on 30 November 2021 and subject to change at any time with or without further notice. We recommend that you re-visit this information from time to time to see if anything has been updated.
screen.fn: Privacy we respect your privacy section 1 body
Privacy we respect your privacy section 2 subtitle
screen.uicontrol:
This TomTom app has features that need location information from your device to work correctly. Your location can be established using satellite, mobile, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth or other network-based positioning methods.

Real-time location services and crowdsourced product improvement

While using this app for the first time, you will see a notification asking for permission to send your location information to TomTom. If you decide to share your location data with TomTom, we can send you real-time information, relevant to where you are, in return such as live-traffic data. Without location permission you cannot use $0#. You can change your permission status at any time in the app privacy settings ("Your location") or through your device. Please note that you may need to change the system settings as well to stop background access to your location data.

We also use location data to improve the quality of our products and services after we made sure the information can no longer be linked back to you. We use different techniques to protect your identity such as encryption and temporary random identifiers to prevent that data can be easily linked back to you or your device. Within 24 hours of shutting down the app or your device, TomTom automatically and irreversibly erases data that we hold which could re-identify you or your device unless you have decided to share your journey data that includes your location data with TomTom. In that case, we generate new temporary random identifiers every time you shut down the app, start a new session or after a maximum of 8 hours. We don't recognise you when you use the app again: we don't know where you have been and can't tell anyone else, even if we were forced to. We never link location data to your TomTom account or any other information that identifies you directly. We also don't sell your location data; our products are 100% ad-free.

Through feedback from our customer community we're able to use de-identified (location) information to continuously improve our products and services, such as TomTom maps, TomTom traffic services including services related to (live) traffic events, speed cameras, weather, EV stations, fuel prices, road hazards and parking. Our products can also include aggregated, anonymised content based on traffic patterns, aggregated driver profiles, non-personally identifiable driver input, and average speeds driven. These products and services are also used by government agencies and businesses.

Share your journey information to improve your experience

You can allow TomTom to use certain information about you to help us analyse driving patterns and behaviour over longer periods. This journey information includes time, location, direction, search interaction, product usage and other behavioural data without associating this data with your identity. Your data and is continuously collected after you have given your permission and helps us to create better products that provide you with the best-in-class navigation experience. For example, if many people don't reach their destination based on a search result, we will use that as a signal to improve our map, so you will get more accurate guidance on the next trip. 

We will store a random identifier on your device which is associated with the journey information sent to TomTom at continuous intervals. We apply different techniques and security measures to protect your journey information against unauthorised access. We will use your journey information to create aggregated, dynamic contextual driver, geographic and behaviour cohorts to analyse data in an abstract way without revealing your device, your identity or any visible data correlations. By 'contextual' we mean that we look for user experiences within a certain context, for example 'users in driver cohort X may also like app feature Z'.

You can change your permission status at any time in the app privacy settings (Your Journeys). If you stop sending your journey information, the random device identifier will no longer be sent to TomTom.

Active and passive feedback

You can tell TomTom what happens on the road by actively reporting traffic incidents, hazards, roadworks, speed cameras, danger zones, speed limits and more. Your reports include location data and could be kept together with information associated with your device. We use this feedback to improve our products. TomTom only shows non-personally identifiable information in road-related updates to other users. You can also decide to share what's happening in the app with others such as your location on the map. Be aware that by using this feature you may share your data with third parties such as Google. TomTom has no influence on how these parties will use your data, check their privacy statements for more information.

TomTom uses push notifications to share feedback with you, for example to send updates about road and traffic conditions. You can disable this in the settings or via your device. When you write an online review about your experience, we may use this data to give feedback.

TomTom could also collect data about the signal strength of the network that you're using in order to check the quality of your connectivity. This helps us to get insights about network coverage in different regions.

Background location usage

When you're driving with the app in the background, we still collect your location information as it's important to know where you are so we can send you relevant road updates and safety alerts on an ongoing basis. Once you are no longer using the app because you reached your destination but forgot to close it, we will close the app automatically after 10 minutes to discontinue the collection of your location information. When you no longer want to share your location data with TomTom you may need to change your system settings as well to stop background access.
screen.fn: Privacy we respect your privacy section 2 body, where {0} is app_name (AmiGO)
Privacy we respect your privacy section 2a subtitle
screen.uicontrol: We work with random session identifiers to improve the quality of the app by analyzing search queries and results linked to a unique interaction. These insights help us for example show relevant POIs within a certain area and improve your search process. However, we don't recognise you when you start a new session, we protect your data and can't link data such as your search queries, location details or destinations directly back to you based on the information that we hold, unless you have decided to share your journey data that includes your search interaction with TomTom. You can change your permission status at any time in the app privacy settings (Your Journeys).
screen.fn: Privacy we respect your privacy section 2a body
Privacy we respect your privacy section 3 subtitle
screen.uicontrol: The app could contain features to save onboard information such as home and work addresses, recent destinations or voice data to make new searches easier. Sometimes data will be stored automatically. TomTom has no access to this data. You can delete this data by using the delete button.
screen.fn: Privacy we respect your privacy section 3 body
Privacy we respect your privacy section 3a subtitle
screen.uicontrol: We may reach out to know if you like our products and if there's something TomTom can do to improve the way users experience our products. You are not obliged to respond to polls or surveys and you always control the information that you wish to share. You can opt out via your device settings by disabling notifications.
screen.fn: Privacy we respect your privacy section 3a body
Privacy Account Section subtitle
screen.uicontrol:
You can create your TomTom account when using this app. We need some details about you:

- email address; this is your username when you log in to your TomTom account. With your permission, we will send you mailings about software updates, the latest news about TomTom products, how to get the most out of your product and exclusive offers. You can easily change your email preferences in your online account settings or unsubscribe via the link in the emails.

- password; we recommend you pick a strong password that you don't use for anything else. We store the password in encrypted code, so we don't even see what your password is.

You can add more custom feeds such as your home, addresses, favourite and recent destinations and vehicle information or register navigation devices to your TomTom account by logging in to $0#. You can also find details there about how to submit requests for accessing or deleting your account data.

Using your account in this app provides the functionality to save your settings, preferences, favourite locations and destinations of your planned routes. This data becomes automatically available to all devices and apps that you have authorised. You could also grant access to others and change the product authorisation at any time. Your account retains references to all your devices or apps associated with your account.

When you disable this functionality, any adjustment of your data such as a planned route will no longer be synchronised with other devices. Your data will remain available in this app, all previously connected devices and in TomTom MyDrive until you actively delete it via $1# or by using devices and apps that support deletion.

With your permission and after we have made sure that data is no longer linked to you, TomTom could use your data to improve its products and services, more details can be found in 'Help us learn' section. You can change this authorisation at any time via the privacy settings. TomTom keeps records of access by authorised devices and apps for a limited period to use this information for technical diagnostic purposes and aggregated statistics and reports.
screen.fn: Privacy Account Section body: {0} and {1} are URLs
screen.uicontrol: Connect your phone with your car
screen.fn: Privacy Connect to Car subtitle
screen.uicontrol:
With CarPlay or Android Auto available in your car, you can connect your phone to the built-in display that shows the app on the screen. The app functionality can be supported by third-party services such as voice assistance, audio, messaging and other assistant features. If you start using CarPlay or Android Auto, your data is collected by Apple or Google in accordance with their privacy policies over which TomTom has no control:

- Google Android Auto: $0#

- Apple CarPlay: $1#
screen.fn: Privacy Connect to Car body: {0} and {1} are URLs
Privacy we respect your privacy section 4 subtitle
screen.uicontrol:
Use of our app

You can help TomTom to keep the app secure, have it performed as expected and improve the user experience of the app, products and services by sharing data on how and when you use this app. This includes information about your device, operating software and information we receive when you use certain features such as locations, route planning, destinations and search items. We make use of third party analytics software without identifying you. We categorize our app users based on aggregated information such as frequency of use, specific features, region information (country and city), and product and device information. Our analysis does not contain individual location information or information that you have entered but may include information that identifies your device unless you have decided to share your journey data that includes your product usage information with TomTom. You can stop sending this information at any time by adjusting the settings in the app or through your device.

In case you're using Android Auto, your car manufacturer may decide to make vehicle data available to third parties such as TomTom. Please check the privacy statement of your car manufacturer and Android for more information.

App diagnostics

This app also sends analytics, technical and diagnostic information to TomTom, for example if the app crashes, which may include information that identifies your device. This helps us to improve our software by analyzing app failures. We use third party analytics software to analyse diagnostic data. Third parties that support our business could also receive this data subject to the privacy policy of that third party, which can be found here:
screen.fn: Privacy we respect your privacy section 4 body
screen.uicontrol:
The collected information may be processed in the USA. You can stop sending this information at any time by adjusting the settings in the app or through your device.

How you found our app

We use a unique device identifier to understand how you have found and interact with our TomTom app: Google Advertising ID on Android and Advertising Identifier on iOS (only functions after your authorization). This identifier is not linked to any directly identifiable personal data such as your name, location or phone number. TomTom may share the encrypted identifier with advertising platforms to show you personalised online advertisements, e.g. via social media where you control personal ad preferences via the privacy settings.

TomTom has no control over how third parties such as Apple, Google and advertising platforms make use of this identifier and what data they collect from you, please read their privacy policies for more information. At any time, you control whether TomTom can use the identifier by approving, resetting or opting out via the operating system settings:

- Apple iOS $0#

- Android $1#

Shortened version of "minute"
Shortened version of "minute: plural"
Shortened version of "hour"
Shortened version of "hour: plural"

Shortened duration format - minute. "m" represents the number, e.g.: if m is 46, text will be "46 min". Only change what's in brackets ("min") to translate the shortened version of "minute". If the language has a different display order, could be changed to "[xxx] m", "xxx" being the translation of "min".

Shortened duration format - hour. "h" represents the number, e.g.: if h is 14, text will be "14 hr". Only change what's in brackets ("hr") to translate the shortened version of "hour". If the language has a different display order, could be changed to "[xxx] hr", "xxx" being the translation of "hr".

Shortened duration format - minute and hour. "h" and "m" represent the numbers, e.g.: if h is 14 and m is 46, text will be "14 hr 46 min". Only change what's in brackets ("hr" and "min") to translate the shortened version of "hour" and "minute". If the language has a different display order, could be changed to "[xxx] h [yyy] m", "m [yyy] h [xxx]" etc. "xxx" and "yyy" being the translations of "hr" and "min" respectively.

Shortened duration format - day. "d" represents the number, e.g.: if d is 5, text will be "5 d". Only change what's in brackets ("d") to translate the shortened version of "day". If the language has a different display order, could be changed to "[xxx] d", "xxx" being the translation of "d".
